title: [oc6beta2] firewall no error when upload is blocked
body:
expected results
 some sort of error stating file cannot be uploaded. perhaps why?

actual results
 file is not uploaded -- no notification made to user

steps
 configure the firewall as such:

[ {
 "type": "condition",
 "check": "upload",
 "negate": true
 },
 {
 "type": "condition",
 "check": "regex",
 "regex": "#a.b.c.d#",
 "criteria": "ip"
 },
 {
 "type": "operator",
 "operator": "or",
 "count": 2
 }]

where a.b.c.d can be any ip that has the ability to upload files

log into owncloud from a.b.c.d and upload a file. notice it is successful.

log into owncloud from another ip. try to upload a file. notice the upload fails, as it should considering only a.b.c.d can upload a file. however, there is no message to the end user stating upload failed or a reason.

installed":"true","version":"6.0.0.3","versionstring":"6.0 beta 2","edition":""}

ubuntu



in  https://github.com/owncloud/enterprise/issues/59 @ringmaster states:

"yeah, i understand how this could be questionable, but i do think this is a core issue. 

i have several thoughts:
 first, if no error message is being displayed when an upload fails in core (regardless of why), isn't that a core issue? second, there really isn't any code i can think of to add to the firewall app that would cause an error message (nice or otherwise) to be displayed in the owncloud web ui that shouldn't already be handled by core somehow. third, the web client wouldn't be the only place where this is an issue, although the desktop sync clients may already deal appropriately with the error that the firewall returns."



so opening in core repository
